trans-unit.source: The SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS table captures information about row sorting actions which occurred during statements that were executed using RUNTIMESTATISTICS with XPLAIN style.

seg-source.mrk: The SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS table captures information about row sorting actions which occurred during statements that were executed using RUNTIMESTATISTICS with XPLAIN style.

target.mrk: The SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS table captures information about row sorting actions which occurred during statements that were executed using RUNTIMESTATISTICS with XPLAIN style.

trans-unit.source: See "Working with RunTimeStatistics" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph> for information on how to configure this.

seg-source.mrk: See "Working with RunTimeStatistics" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph> for information on how to configure this.

target.mrk: See "Working with RunTimeStatistics" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph> for information on how to configure this.

trans-unit.source: Rows in this table are typically joined with rows in SYSXPLAIN_STATEMENTS and SYSXPLAIN_RESULTSETS during analysis.

seg-source.mrk: Rows in this table are typically joined with rows in SYSXPLAIN_STATEMENTS and SYSXPLAIN_RESULTSETS during analysis.

target.mrk: Rows in this table are typically joined with rows in SYSXPLAIN_STATEMENTS and SYSXPLAIN_RESULTSETS during analysis.

trans-unit.source: select s.stmt_text, rs.op_identifier, srt.no_input_rows, srt.no_output_rows from my_stats.sysxplain_sort_props srt, my_stats.sysxplain_resultsets rs, my_stats.sysxplain_statements s where rs.stmt_id = s.stmt_id and rs.sort_rs_id = srt.sort_rs_id

seg-source.mrk: select s.stmt_text, rs.op_identifier, srt.no_input_rows, srt.no_output_rows from my_stats.sysxplain_sort_props srt, my_stats.sysxplain_resultsets rs, my_stats.sysxplain_statements s where rs.stmt_id = s.stmt_id and rs.sort_rs_id = srt.sort_rs_id

target.mrk: select s.stmt_text, rs.op_identifier, srt.no_input_rows, srt.no_output_rows from my_stats.sysxplain_sort_props srt, my_stats.sysxplain_resultsets rs, my_stats.sysxplain_statements s where rs.stmt_id = s.stmt_id and rs.sort_rs_id = srt.sort_rs_id

trans-unit.source: Rows in this table are added automatically when <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> has been configured appropriately. The rows remain in the table until you delete them or drop the table.

seg-source.mrk: Rows in this table are added automatically when <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> has been configured appropriately.
The rows remain in the table until you delete them or drop the table.

target.mrk: Rows in this table are added automatically when <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> has been configured appropriately.
The rows remain in the table until you delete them or drop the table.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the contents of the SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS system table.

seg-source.mrk: The following table shows the contents of the SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS system table.

target.mrk: The following table shows the contents of the SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS system table.

trans-unit.source: For each column in the SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS system table, this table provides its data type, its length in bytes, whether it is nullable, and a description of its contents.

seg-source.mrk: For each column in the SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS system table, this table provides its data type, its length in bytes, whether it is nullable, and a description of its contents.

target.mrk: For each column in the SYSXPLAIN_SORT_PROPS system table, this table provides its data type, its length in bytes, whether it is nullable, and a description of its contents.

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier for this row. Matches the corresponding value of SORT_RS_ID in the my_stats.SYSXPLAIN_RESULTSETS row for the result set which required this sort to be performed.

seg-source.mrk: A unique identifier for this row.
Matches the corresponding value of SORT_RS_ID in the my_stats.SYSXPLAIN_RESULTSETS row for the result set which required this sort to be performed.

target.mrk: A unique identifier for this row.
Matches the corresponding value of SORT_RS_ID in the my_stats.SYSXPLAIN_RESULTSETS row for the result set which required this sort to be performed.

trans-unit.source: A code indicating the type of sort that was performed. The code values include 'IN' for an internal sort, and 'EX' for an external sort. An internal sort is one which was entirely performed in-memory and did not overflow to any temporary files, while an external sort used one or more external files.

seg-source.mrk: A code indicating the type of sort that was performed.
The code values include 'IN' for an internal sort, and 'EX' for an external sort.
An internal sort is one which was entirely performed in-memory and did not overflow to any temporary files, while an external sort used one or more external files.

target.mrk: A code indicating the type of sort that was performed.
The code values include 'IN' for an internal sort, and 'EX' for an external sort.
An internal sort is one which was entirely performed in-memory and did not overflow to any temporary files, while an external sort used one or more external files.

trans-unit.source: Number of rows which were provided to the sorter.

seg-source.mrk: Number of rows which were provided to the sorter.

target.mrk: Number of rows which were provided to the sorter.

trans-unit.source: Number of rows which were returned by the sorter. Note that this may be fewer rows than were input, for example when the sorter is performing GROUP BY processing or is eliminating duplicates.

seg-source.mrk: Number of rows which were returned by the sorter.
Note that this may be fewer rows than were input, for example when the sorter is performing GROUP BY processing or is eliminating duplicates.

target.mrk: Number of rows which were returned by the sorter.
Note that this may be fewer rows than were input, for example when the sorter is performing GROUP BY processing or is eliminating duplicates.

trans-unit.source: Number of merge runs which were provided. This value will be NULL for an internal sort, but for an external sort it indicates how many times the intermediate sort files were merged together. External sorts are far more expensive than internal sorts, and each additional merge run that an external sort must perform adds considerably more to the overhead of the sort.

seg-source.mrk: Number of merge runs which were provided.
This value will be NULL for an internal sort, but for an external sort it indicates how many times the intermediate sort files were merged together.
External sorts are far more expensive than internal sorts, and each additional merge run that an external sort must perform adds considerably more to the overhead of the sort.

target.mrk: Number of merge runs which were provided.
This value will be NULL for an internal sort, but for an external sort it indicates how many times the intermediate sort files were merged together.
External sorts are far more expensive than internal sorts, and each additional merge run that an external sort must perform adds considerably more to the overhead of the sort.

trans-unit.source: Additional information about the size of the merge runs. This value will be NULL for an internal sort.

seg-source.mrk: Additional information about the size of the merge runs.
This value will be NULL for an internal sort.

target.mrk: Additional information about the size of the merge runs.
This value will be NULL for an internal sort.

trans-unit.source: A code indicating whether or not this sort eliminated duplicates from the input. Valid values are 'Y' and 'N'. This column only applies for a sort which was NOT performing GROUP BY aggregation; for GROUP BY sorts this column is always NULL. See the DISTINCT_AGGREGATE column for the corresponding information for aggregating sorts.

seg-source.mrk: A code indicating whether or not this sort eliminated duplicates from the input.
This column only applies for a sort which was NOT performing GROUP BY aggregation; for GROUP BY sorts this column is always NULL.
See the DISTINCT_AGGREGATE column for the corresponding information for aggregating sorts.

target.mrk: A code indicating whether or not this sort eliminated duplicates from the input.
This column only applies for a sort which was NOT performing GROUP BY aggregation; for GROUP BY sorts this column is always NULL.
See the DISTINCT_AGGREGATE column for the corresponding information for aggregating sorts.

trans-unit.source: A code indicating whether or not the rows which were input to the sorter were already in sort order, which can happen if the rows were retrieved by using an index, or if an earlier phase of processing had already sorted the data. The code is 'Y' if the rows are already in sorted order, and 'N' otherwise.

seg-source.mrk: A code indicating whether or not the rows which were input to the sorter were already in sort order, which can happen if the rows were retrieved by using an index, or if an earlier phase of processing had already sorted the data.
The code is 'Y' if the rows are already in sorted order, and 'N' otherwise.

target.mrk: A code indicating whether or not the rows which were input to the sorter were already in sort order, which can happen if the rows were retrieved by using an index, or if an earlier phase of processing had already sorted the data.
The code is 'Y' if the rows are already in sorted order, and 'N' otherwise.

trans-unit.source: A code indicating whether the aggregation process was computing distinct aggregates or not. Valid values are 'Y' and 'N'.

seg-source.mrk: A code indicating whether the aggregation process was computing distinct aggregates or not.

target.mrk: A code indicating whether the aggregation process was computing distinct aggregates or not.
